comments:
I hope you can help me because I don't know why this problem occour. 

What I just do is, I start the "Build All" wizzard in an updatesite-project and
then get this PDE Export error together with a log.zip file on the root point of
the update site. 
In the logfile there is a regarding Ant log of the pde-project, that was to be
built, complaining about a failing import statement. 
But this is strange, because if I start the build of this project manually in
Ant it works fine. 

So how can I export/build my whole updatesite at once? 

Thanks for your help! 

Best Regards, Michael 

Output of my PDE-Error: 
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match
outer scope rule:
MultiRule[P/com.amadeus.eclipse_update-site,org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob$SchedulingRule@1621103]

at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:58) 
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:106) 
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.push(ThreadJob.java:200) 
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:80) 
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:170) 
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.java:95) 
at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.prepareOperation(Workspace.java:1628) 
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal(Resource.java:1224) 
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.BuildSiteJob.refresh(BuildSiteJob.java:53) 
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.BuildSiteJob.run(BuildSiteJob.java:42) 
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)
Would you be able to provide a reproduceable test case?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Would you be able to provide a reproduceable test case?
Yes, sure!
What can I deliver to you in order to help you debugging?

The smaller the better.
A workspace or a couple of projects would be good and steps to reproduce the pb
from there. Also please tell me which version of eclipse you are using (help >
about sdk > build id)
Make sure that you don't put your company's code out there :)
The user had a structural pb in the features.
